heisigStory: Maybe this helps you see how the Japanese have no trouble keeping convex distinct from concave. Note the odd feeling of the third stroke. If it doesn't feel all that strange now, by the time you are done with this book, it will. There are very few times you will have to write it.
koohiiStory1: When I get vexed, I give people the middle finger.
words: 凸凹(でこぼこ): unevenness, roughness, ruggedness
